name: Women Writers, 1660-1800
description: A study of poems, plays, novels, letters, periodical essays, polemical works, and books for children by such writers as Cavendish, Behn, Finch, Centlivre, Leapor, Burney, Wollstonecraft. Topics may include patronage and publishing; nationality, class, and gender; and generic conventions.
prerequisites: 1.0 credit in ENG and 3.0 additional credits
